  • tests.pose_tf_graph_mode_test

Source code for tests.pose_tf_graph_mode_test

import tensorflow as tf

from unittest import TestCase

from pose_format.pose_test import _get_random_pose_object_with_tf_posebody



[docs]class TestPose(TestCase):
    """
    Testcases for the Pose object with TensorFlow operations in graph mode.
    """

[docs]    def test_pose_tf_posebody_normalize_graph_mode_does_not_fail(self):
        """
        Tests if the normalization of Pose object with TensorFlow PoseBody in graph mode does not fail.
        
        Checks that the TensorFlow operations are executed in graph mode and the Pose object can be normalized without errors.
        """
        with tf.Graph().as_default():

            assert tf.executing_eagerly() is False

            pose = _get_random_pose_object_with_tf_posebody(num_keypoints=5)

            # in the mock data header components are named 0, 1, and so on
            # individual points are named 0_a, 0_b, and so on
            pose.normalize(pose.header.normalization_info(
                p1=("0", "0_a"),
                p2=("0", "0_b")
            ))



[docs]    def test_pose_tf_posebody_frame_dropout_uniform_graph_mode_does_not_fail(self):
        """
        Tests if frame dropout using uniform distribution in Pose object with TensorFlow PoseBody in graph mode does not fail.
        
        Checks that the TensorFlow operations are executed in graph mode and the Pose object can undergo frame dropout using uniform distribution without errors.
        """
        with tf.Graph().as_default():

            assert tf.executing_eagerly() is False

            pose = _get_random_pose_object_with_tf_posebody(num_keypoints=5)
            pose.frame_dropout_uniform()



[docs]    def test_pose_tf_posebody_frame_dropout_normal_graph_mode_does_not_fail(self):
        """
        Tests if frame dropout using normal distribution in Pose object with TensorFlow PoseBody in graph mode does not fail.
        
        Chacks that TensorFlow operations are in graph mode and the Pose object can undergo frame dropout using normal distribution without errors.
        """
        with tf.Graph().as_default():

            assert tf.executing_eagerly() is False

            pose = _get_random_pose_object_with_tf_posebody(num_keypoints=5)
            pose.frame_dropout_normal()
